entry.et: Middle English boton, from Anglo-French butun rose hip, stud, from buter to thrust butt

def.dt: :a small knob or disk secured to an article (as of clothing) and used as a fastener by passing it through a buttonhole or loop
:a usually circular metal or plastic badge bearing a stamped design or printed slogan campaign button
:something that resembles a button: as
:any of various parts or growths of a plant or of an animal: as
:bud
:an immature whole mushroom
:button mushroom
:the terminal segment of a rattlesnake's rattle
:a small globule of metal remaining after fusion (as in assaying)
:a guard on the tip of a fencing foil
:push button
:something (as a push button) that has the real or symbolic capability of initiating a catastrophe (as a nuclear attack) has his finger on the button
:a hidden sensitivity that can be manipulated to produce a desired response knows how to push my buttons
:a usually box-shaped computer icon that initiates a specific software function
:the point of the chin especially as a target for a knockout blow
:exactly arrived at noon on the button
:exactly on target :on the nose the estimate was right on the button
:to furnish or decorate with buttons
:to pass (a button) through a buttonhole or loop
:to close or fasten with buttons often used with up button up your overcoat
:to close (the lips) to prevent speech button your lip
:to close or seal tightly usually used with up button up the house for winter
:to have buttons for fastening this dress buttons at the back
:having the ends fastened to the garment with buttons
:having a button-down collar
:conservatively traditional or conventional
:adhering to conventional norms in dress and behavior button–down businessmen
:a shirt with a button-down collar
:a low-ranking member of a criminal underworld organization
:a usually small white mushroom (Agaricus bisporus syn. A. brunnescens) in which the pileus has not yet expanded
:any of a family (Turnicidae) of small terrestrial Old World birds that resemble quails and have only three toes on a foot with the hind toe being absent
:blazing star 2a
:any of several usually prickly herbs (genus Eryngium) of the carrot family
:a European composite (Centaurea cyanus) having flower heads with usually blue, pink, or white rays that is often cultivated in North America called also cornflower
:the human navel
